tweet.text: ultraculture a little late to the party here but i loved your sweary little bit about the cinematic experience
ollymoss thanks olzsvery excited to pick up your book
ultraculture we still need to bottle our natural chemistry and release it as some sort of podcasty type thing
ollymoss when are you in london next
saileshkrish well can be surprising the sum of an empty set of numbers is also 0
i wish nosql databases would not use the term column when they really mean field or keyvalue pair in a map column implies always there
markmadsen it doesnt bug me as much a column whose value might be not present not necessarily the same as null works fine for me
julianhyde and that can make a difference to a person who is not steeped in such things as they read both presence and persistence into it
markmadsen i agree a column is structural its there even if there are no rows records that demonstrate it julianhyde
rolandbouman markmadsen my optiq driver for splunk puts sql on top of splunks virtual columns they exist if you ask for them
julianhyde i think a long conversation on optiq splunk is in order to understand how one does agg fns over possibly missing elementsrows
markmadsen would enjoy that til then did you know that in the sql spec agg funs are not called on values that are null
julianhyde markmadsen doesnt it depend on whether the function is defined with called on null input
saileshkrish markmadsen true but original and imho more natural behavior is call only with notnull values count etc all work that way
julianhyde markmadsen wait a secsare you saying natural behavior is call only w notnull valuesscount wouldnt givesright results
saileshkrish julianhyde markmadsen countf only counts thesof rows with nonnull values in column f
neilconway julianhyde markmadsen but count looks at all rows right
saileshkrish julianhyde markmadsen yep a foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds
neilconway julianhyde markmadsen now now control yourself there
saileshkrish neilconway it is consistent and not foolish in countsacts as a notnull value just like count1
julianhyde saileshkrish sure i was being glib that said sql aggs have quirks eg sum of empty table is null count of empty is 0
neilconway julianhyde more acc to say thatsrefers to record variable and not attribute count of empty being 0 feels right why quirk
neilconway dont think i agree with that its an empty set surely we have had this debate earliersdejavu
saileshkrish i think we likely have
saileshkrish i think we likely have
